repnme.cdata!:
Bulgaria - Second Financial and Enterprise
            Sector Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability highly likely, though
            institutional development impacts are modest, but, both
            performances by the Bank, and Borrower are rated
            satisfactory. Key lessons suggest that the existence of a
            well-defined multi-year program, as a pre-requisite to
            project design, contributed to a successful implementation,
            particularly given the fact that as a one tranche operation,
            completion of critical performance benchmarks had to be
            supported, while Government commitments to sustained reforms
            needed reinforcement. However, the use of a single tranche
            adjustment loan was appropriate due to country conditions,
            for it provided flexibility to enable both the Government,
            and the Bank, assess the experience in program
            implementation, and strengthen the program as needed. This
            adjustment process would have been difficult under a
            multi-tranche operation. In addition, parallel operations
            focused on reforms, provided a timely, and well coordinated
            comprehensive framework in the reform agenda, which could
            not have been accomplished had all reforms been incorporated
            into this one project, and, the complementary nature of the
            project was conducive to an excellent communication, and
            coordination between the Bank, and the Fund. Nonetheless,
            the lack of an accompanying technical assistance loan, and
            the subsequent reliance on donors, required intensive
            coordination of donor activities, increasing implementation
            dependency on donor coordination.

1551981.trustfund:
TF025877-PHRD-FINANCIAL & ENTERPRISE
            SECTOR ADJUSTMENT,TF025585-PHRD-SECOND FINANCIAL &
            ENTERPRISE SECTOR ADJ.LOAN/CREDIT 2,TF025280-PHRD-FINANCIAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE

repnme.cdata!:
Bulgaria - Second Financial and Enterprise
            Sector Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Second Financial
            and Enterprise Sector Adjustment Loan Project is to support:
            1) substantial progress in the implementation of structural
            reforms in the financial and enterprise sectors, and 2) the
            initial phase of the energy sector restructuring program.
            Specifically, the loan provides foreign exchange for balance
            of payments support. It is conditioned on substantial
            progress in implementing structural reforms in the financial
            and enterprise sectors, and the implementation of the
            initial phase of the restructuring of the energy sector. The
            loan helps accelerate progress in the privatization and
            liquidation of state-owned enterprises, the sustaining of
            banking reforms including privatization of public sector
            banks and upgrading of banking supervision capacity, the
            maintenance of financial discipline, and the implementation
            of the initial phase of the restructuring of the energy
            sector. Progress in the reforms supported by the loan will
            sustain the gains from macroeconomic stabilization and
            deepen the transition to a market economy.
